Apple___Black_rot.summary: A fungal disease that causes dark lesions on leaves and fruit, often circular and sunken.
advice: Use a fungicide spray approved for apples.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.summary: Rust disease appearing as orange or rust-colored spots on apple leaves and fruit.
advice: Apply fungicide early in the season.
Prune affected areas to prevent spread.

Apple___scab.summary: Fungal disease that causes dark, scabby spots on leaves and fruit.
advice: Use resistant apple varieties when possible.
Apply fungicide during early leaf growth.
Monitor weekly for early disease signs.

Bell_Pepper___Bacterial_spot.summary: A bacterial infection that causes small, dark spots on leaves and fruits.
advice: Disinfect tools and avoid handling plants when wet.

Cherry___Powdery_mildew.summary: White or grayish powdery coating on leaves caused by fungal growth.

advice: Check underside of leaves for early mold.

Grape___Black_rot.summary: Dark circular lesions on leaves and berries caused by fungal infection.

Grape___Esca_Black_measles.summary: Fungal disease causing leaf burn, dark spots, and internal wood decay.

Grape___Leaf_blight.summary: Blight causing brown patches and leaf curling.

Grape___Bacterial_spot.summary: Small angular spots caused by bacteria; may ooze under humidity.

Peach___Bacterial_spot.summary: Bacterial infection forming angular dark lesions on leaves and fruits.

advice: Monitor regularly for leaf curl or spots.

Potato___Early_Blight.summary: Brown circular spots with concentric rings caused by Alternaria solani fungus.
advice: Rotate crops to reduce fungal persistence.

Potato___Late_Blight.summary: Serious disease causing brown lesions and leaf rot under wet conditions.
advice: Use copper-based fungicides before wet weather.
Check underside of leaves for white mold.

Strawberry___Leaf_Scorch.summary: Fungal disease that dries leaf edges and turns them reddish brown.
advice: Avoid watering late in the day.
Use mulch to prevent splash infection.
Inspect weekly for aphids and fungi.

Tomato___Bacterial_Spot.summary: Bacterial disease forming small, water-soaked spots on leaves and fruit.

Tomato___Early_Blight.summary: Dark concentric ring spots appearing on lower leaves, spreading upward.
advice: Water at soil level instead of overhead.
Use alternating fungicides during rainy periods.

Tomato___Late_Blight.summary: Deadly fungus-like disease causing leaf rot and white mold under wet conditions.
advice: Spray preventive fungicides weekly during high humidity.
Use mulch to prevent soil splash.
Capture a clearer photo of the infected area.
Try multiple leaves for better accuracy.
